alert.note: Alert for Upper Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 14 at 5:50PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Kuskokwim River at McGrath * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Localized minor flooding in low lying areas is possible. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Water levels continue to rise on the Kuskokwim River at McGrath and are approaching bankfull in some locations. Ice is still in place downriver from McGrath and there is the possibility of an ice jam forming as more ice comes downriver. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Kuskokwim River at McGrath stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
